attributes.action: MPs must prevent Article 50 being signed, in the interests of the nation.
attributes.additional_details:
The damage of Brexit is now felt: currency collapse; inflation; credit rating downgrade; immigration promises broken; job losses; lost research opportunities; political chaos; loss of Scotland and even Northern Ireland from Union; no extra NHS investment; lost EU grants and influence; uncertainty, legal, economic and political; recession & more austerity.

The referendum campaigns failed to explain the true results of a Brexit. After the vote people are increasingly horrified by the outcome.
attributes.background: After a dirty EU referendum, the public feels deceived. MPs must reflect the changed public mood and stop Article 50 being signed. They have no mandate to decide terms of a catastrophic exit agreement. The national interests must be urgently protected. MPs must represent constituents interests.
